Clone your protein of interest in the pGADT7-RecAB vector, and two or more interactor proteins into the pGBKT7 vector using standard procedures in E. coli and proceed to yeast transformation.

1. Inoculate 10 ml of YPAD medium with a single fresh AH109 colony and incubate overnight on a shaker at 30˚C. Dilute the overnight culture with fresh to OD600  of 0.15 and incubate with shaking for approximately 2 h until OD600 is around 0.7.
Pellet the cells at 2000 g for 5 min at room temperature, pour off or aspirate the medium, resuspend the cells in 10 ml LiAc buffer and centrifuge again.
Resuspend the pellet in 500 μl LiAc.

To 50 μl of the suspension of yeast competent cells add 1-3 μg DNA plasmids harboring each of the two interactor partners \(in GBKT7 and GADT7-RecAB), 300 μl sterile 40% w/v PEG-3350 solution in LiAc buffer, 25 μl salmon sperm DNA, and sterile water to 400 μl final volume.

Gently mix and incubate at room temperature for 30 min. 
  5.

Plate the shocked cells onto the SD -Trp, -Leu selective media and incubate for 2-3 days at 30˚C.
  7.

Streak several of the grown-up colonies of each cotransfromant on:
  a) SD -LEU, -HIS, -TRP \(low stringency plates)
b) SD -Leu,-Trp plates supplemented with α-X-Gal \(plate for growth-independent test for α-galactosidase)
c) SD -Ade, -LEU, -HIS, -TRP supplemented with α-X-Gal \(high stringency plates).
8. Incubate the plates for 3 days at 30˚C and compare growth of your interactor pairs on media with different stringency.
If the color of the colonies is ambiguous, incubate the plates at 15˚C for three more days and recheck.
